name: Barnstable
description: Barnstable is a picturesque town on Cape Cod, Massachusetts, known for its beautiful beaches, historic sites, vibrant local culture, and outdoor activities. As the largest community on Cape Cod, it offers a perfect blend of natural beauty, rich history, and modern amenities for tourists.

attractions.name: Craigville Beach
attractions.description: A popular beach destination with soft sand and calm waters, perfect for swimming, sunbathing, and beach volleyball. The beach offers stunning views of Nantucket Sound and is ideal for families.

attractions.name: Sturgis Library
attractions.description: One of the oldest libraries in the United States, offering a rich collection of historical documents, books, and genealogical resources. The building itself dates back to 1644 and has a fascinating history.
attractions.opening_hours: Monday-Friday: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM

attractions.name: Hyannis Harbor
attractions.description: A bustling harbor with ferries to Martha's Vineyard and Nantucket. Visitors can enjoy waterfront dining, shopping, and scenic boat tours. The harbor is also home to the John F. Kennedy Hyannis Museum.

attractions.name: Sandy Neck Beach
attractions.description: A 6-mile long barrier beach with hiking trails, off-road vehicle access, and opportunities for wildlife viewing. It's a great spot for birdwatching and enjoying unspoiled natural beauty.
attractions.address: 425 Sandy Neck Rd, West Barnstable, MA 02668

attractions.name: Cape Cod Potato Chip Factory
attractions.description: Take a self-guided tour of this famous potato chip factory to see how the chips are made and enjoy free samples.

restaurants.name: The Black Cat Tavern
restaurants.description: A waterfront restaurant offering fresh seafood and classic New England dishes. Enjoy lobster rolls, clam chowder, and stunning harbor views.

restaurants.name: Pain D'Avignon
restaurants.description: A charming bakery and caf√© serving artisan breads, pastries, and gourmet coffee. They also offer a full breakfast and lunch menu with locally-sourced ingredients.

restaurants.name: Dolphin Restaurant
restaurants.description: A family-owned restaurant since 1947, serving fresh seafood and traditional Cape Cod fare in a casual atmosphere.

restaurants.name: Alberto's Ristorante
restaurants.description: Upscale Italian dining with a focus on fresh seafood and homemade pasta. Enjoy their extensive wine list and cozy atmosphere.

accommodations.name: The Hyannis Harbor Hotel
accommodations.description: A modern hotel located right on the harbor, offering comfortable rooms, an indoor pool, and great views of the marina.

accommodations.name: The Captain David Kelley House
accommodations.description: A historic bed and breakfast with charming rooms, gourmet breakfasts, and excellent hospitality. Located in a quiet residential area near Craigville Beach.

accommodations.name: Cape Codder Resort & Spa
accommodations.description: Family-friendly resort featuring an indoor water park, full-service spa, and multiple dining options. Perfect for those seeking a mix of relaxation and entertainment.

accommodations.name: Lamb and Lion Inn
accommodations.description: A charming inn with individually decorated rooms, beautiful gardens, and a salt water pool. Known for its personalized service and peaceful atmosphere.

activities.name: Whale Watching
activities.description: Experience the thrill of seeing whales up close on a guided boat tour. Learn about marine life from expert naturalists.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the beautiful coastlines and waterways of Barnstable by kayak. Guided tours and rentals available for all skill levels.

activities.name: Cape Cod Rail Trail
activities.description: Enjoy a scenic bike ride on this 22-mile paved trail that winds through several Cape Cod towns. Bike rentals available nearby.
activities.address: Various access points throughout Cape Cod

activities.name: Barnstable Harbor Ecotours
activities.description: Take a guided tour of the Great Marsh, learning about local ecology, history, and wildlife. Perfect for nature enthusiasts and photographers.

events.name: Barnstable County Fair
events.description: Annual fair featuring rides, live music, agricultural exhibits, and food vendors. Typically held in July.
events.location: 1220 Nathan Ellis Highway, East Falmouth, MA 02536

events.name: Hyannis Summer Arts and Craft Festival
events.description: Weekend-long festival showcasing local artisans, crafters, and musicians. Held on the Hyannis Village Green in July.
